data.title: Polina Osetinskaya
data.text:
Evgenia Dobrovolskaya and Sergey Chonishvili talk to the audience about love, telling the stories of famous poetic tandems in the language of their own poems dedicated to each other. Marina Tsvetaeva and Boris Pasternak, Anna Akhmatova and Nikolai Gumilev, Georgy Ivanov and Irina Odoevtseva, Yevgeny Yevtushenko and Bella Akhmadulina. Poems add up to a whole kaleidoscope of stories: passionate infatuations, fatal meetings, tedious expectations, tragic breakups, painful long-distance relationships, stupid infidelities and painful divorces. And couples form strange and sometimes unexpected interweaving of destinies. Elena Revich (violin) and Polina Ossetinskaya (piano) complement poetry with music that exists in this performance along with the word.

Leonid Desyatnikov

“Echoes of Theatre”, suite for piano

Alfred Schnittke

“Revis Fairy Tale”, suite for two pianos from the music for the spectacle of Taganka Theatre for two pianos

Leonid Desyatnikov

Nocturne from the motion picture “Giselle’s Mania” for piano

“Du cote de chez Swan” (“Swan’s Way”) for two pianos

Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky

Two fragments from the balley “Sleeping Beauty” (arranged for piano four hands by Desyatnikov)

Andrei Petrov

Overture from the movie “Taming of the Fire” for two pianos

Waltz from the movie “Beware of the Car” for two pianos

Mikael Tariverdiev

Intermezzo from the movie “Seventeen Moments of Spring” for two pianos

Vladislav Uspenskiy

Waltz from musical drama “Anna Karenina” for two pianos

Leonid Desyatnikov

Lullaby from the motion picture “Moscow” for piano

Foxtrot from the motion picture “Target” for piano four hands

Valerii Gavrilin

Pieces from “Sketches” for piano four hands (used later in “Anyuta” ballet): Walz. Clocks. Tarantella

Leonid Desyatnikov

Sketches to sunset

George Gershwin

Music from the opera “Porgy and Bess” (3 pieces)

Leonid Desyatnikov

Nocturne from the Alexei Uchitel’s film “Giselle’s Mania”

“Credit Titles” from Valerii Todorovski’s film “Moscow Nights”

Harry Warren

“I Know Why” from the H. Bruce Humberstone’s film “Sun Valley Serenade”

Charlie Chaplin

“Smile” from the Charlie Chaplin’s film “Modern Times”

Sergey Dreznin

Fantasy for piano and violin (after Dunayevsky).

Nino Rota

Suite for piano from the Federico Fellini’s film “Casanova”

Pietro Mascagni

Intermezzo from the opera “Cavalleria rusticana” from the Francis Ford Coppola’s “The Godfather”

Sergey Dreznin

“To the memory of Michael”

Carlos Gardel

“Por una cabeza” from the Martin Brest’s film “Scent of a Woman”
